results.title: Ben Zobrist Was Never the Guy for the Mets; Yoenis Cespedes Is
results.abstract: The Mets, blessed with pitching, need to pursue a genuine power hitter like Cespedes, who led the team to the pennant last season.

multimedia.caption: Yoenis Cespedes hit two home runs, including this one against the Dodgers in Game 3 of the N.L.D.S., and drove in seven runs in nine playoff games.

results.title: Mets Acquire Neil Walker in Trade for Jon Niese
results.abstract: The move essentially cuts ties with two of the longest tenured Mets: Niese and Daniel Murphy, the free-agent second baseman.

results.title: This Time, Cubs Beat Mets by Signing Zobrist, a Top Free Agent
results.abstract: Zobrist, who had also been pursued by the Giants and the Nationals, signed a four-year, $56 million deal.

multimedia.caption: Ben Zobrist striding past the Mets’ David Wright in Game 4 of the World Series. Zobrist would have given the Mets depth and flexibility in the infield.

results.title: Warriors’ Streak Inches Closer to Lakers’ 33-Gamer
results.abstract: If it keeps winning, Golden State (23-0), which has won 27 straight dating to last season, could match the Lakers’ streak on Dec. 25 against Cleveland.

multimedia.caption: The 1971-72 Lakers won 33 straight games with a lineup that included the Hall of Famers Wilt Chamberlain, left, Jerry West, right, and Gail Goodrich.
The 1971-72 Lakers won 33 straight games with a lineup that included the Hall of Famers Wilt Chamberlain, left, Jerry West, right, and Gail Goodrich.

results.title: Nets Complete Season Sweep of Rockets
results.abstract: Brook Lopez, Joe Johnson and Thaddeus Young each scored 20 points or more, and the host Nets defeated Houston for the second time this year.

results.title: On Artificial Turf Issue, U.S. Women Dig In at Last
results.abstract: By refusing to play a match on what it called an unsafe field, the United States women’s national soccer team put its popularity to good use.
org_facet: United States Women's National Soccer Team

multimedia.caption: Goalie Hope Solo of the United States shared a photo of the Aloha Stadium conditions with her Twitter followers, which number over one million.

results.title: Head of U.S. Soccer Apologizes for Cancellation
results.abstract: Sunil Gulati, the president of U.S. Soccer, said a “series of mistakes” led to a failure to ensure a field was suitable for an international women’s soccer match.
org_facet: United States Women's National Soccer Team

multimedia.caption: Sunil Gulati, center, gave out gold medals to the U.S. women's national team in July. On Tuesday he issued an apology.

results.title: A Life on the Move Molds a U.C.L.A. Basketball Star
results.abstract: Nirra Fields, whose journey included three high schools and a half-dozen moves, is a top guard on a top team and a likely W.N.B.A. draft pick.

multimedia.caption: Nirra Fields, a senior guard at U.C.L.A., being introduced before a game last month. Last season, she led the Bruins to the W.N.I.T. championship.

results.title: Disappointing Addition to UConn’s Long History at Madison Square Garden
results.abstract: Connecticut, which first played at the Garden in 1951, fell to Maryland in the late game of the Jimmy V Classic, the Huskies’ 114th game at the arena.

multimedia.caption: Maryland's Melo Trimble driving on Connecticut's Shonn Miller on Tuesday. Trimble scored a game-high 25 points.

results.title: Graham McNamee Wins Frick Award for Baseball Broadcasting
results.abstract: McNamee, who called the World Series on radio from 1923 to 1934, was the top vote-getter in a new system that alternates voting among three eras.

multimedia.caption: Graham McNamee was at Yankee Stadium in 1928 to call Game 1 of the World Series between St. Louis and New York.

results.title: Honoring Broadcasters, No Audio Required
results.abstract: The Ford C. Frick Award will be presented to a broadcaster whose work spanned the 1920s to the mid-1950s, but the dearth of audio from that era has made the voting process difficult.

multimedia.caption: Bob Wolff, 95, a winner of the Ford C. Frick Award, sits on the committee that will pick this year’s honoree.

results.title: Few Wins but Much Chaos at Rutgers After Move to the Big Ten
results.abstract: The tumult since the New Jersey state university gained membership in the sports conference in 2014 has made it an example of how colleges can go astray in a bid for prime-time athletics.
org_facet: Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey

multimedia.caption: From left, the president of Rutgers, Robert L. Barchi; the university's new head football coach, Chris Ash; and its new director of athletics, Patrick Hobbs, on Monday at the announcement of Mr. Ash's hiring.

results.title: N.H.L. This Week: Reunions in Toronto and Edmonton
results.abstract: The Devils travel to Toronto on Tuesday to see their old boss, and the Rangers will visit their former backup goalie Cam Talbot in Edmonton on Friday.

results.title: Live and Kicking: Soccer Games to Watch This Week
results.abstract: This week is as busy as last week was (relatively) quiet. The soccer editor and shameless Ajax supporter Andrew Das tells you what to watch.

results.title: Yankees, Seeking to Get Younger, Acquire Starlin Castro From the Cubs
results.abstract: Castro is their new second baseman, arriving Tuesday in a deal with the Chicago Cubs for pitcher Adam Warren and a player to be named.

multimedia.caption: Starlin Castro with the Cubs in August. He is a three-time All-Star and once led the National League in hits.

results.title: Aroldis Chapman Not Charged; Trade Delayed
results.abstract: The police in Davie, Fla., said there was insufficient evidence to charge Chapman, who had been traded from the Reds to the Dodgers.

multimedia.caption: Aroldis Chapman’s status is being reviewed under baseball’s domestic violence policy, but there is no timetable for a decision.
Aroldis Chapman’s status is being reviewed under baseball’s domestic violence policy, but there is no timetable for a decision.

results.title: Yasiel Puig Will Join Cuba Trip
results.abstract: Puig, a Dodgers outfielder who defected from Cuba in 2012, will join a good-will tour, sponsored by Major League Baseball and the players’ union, next week.

results.title: Winston and Mariota Are Rare Rookie Quarterback Success Stories
results.abstract: The Buccaneers’ Jameis Winston and the Titans’ Marcus Mariota have grown up quickly in the N.F.L., where rookies rarely thrive.

multimedia.caption: The Titans’ Marcus Mariota, left, and the Buccaneers’ Jameis Winston both led their teams to exciting victories on Sunday.

results.title: ESPN and College Football Playoff Agree Not to Air Daily Fantasy Ads
results.abstract: The telecasts of the national semifinals and the national championship game this season will not feature advertising for daily fantasy websites like DraftKings and FanDuel.

results.title: Nobody’s in a Hurry to Win the N.F.C. East
results.abstract: The weekend’s games did not provide any clarity in the division, as three teams are now 5-7, and the one that is 4-8 might have the best shot to advance.

multimedia.caption: Eric Rowe celebrated an incomplete pass in the fourth quarter of the Eagles' 35-28 victory over the Patriots on Sunday.

results.title: Johnny Manziel Back as Starter for Browns
results.abstract: All may be forgiven in Cleveland as Coach Mike Pettine decides to play Manziel at quarterback after benching him for two games.

results.title: Jailed South American Official in FIFA Case Agrees to Extradition
results.abstract: The president of Conmebol, Juan Ángel Napout, who was arrested in Zurich last week, agreed to be extradited on Tuesday, the Swiss authorities said.
org_facet: Confederation of North, Central American and Caribbean Association Football (CONCACAF)

multimedia.caption: Juan Ángel Napout is accused of accepting millions of dollars in bribes from businessmen in exchange for steering lucrative soccer marketing contracts to them.
Juan Ángel Napout is accused of accepting millions of dollars in bribes from businessmen in exchange for steering lucrative soccer marketing contracts to them.

results.title: Cristiano Ronaldo Sets Scoring Record
results.abstract: Ronaldo’s four goals in Real Madrid’s victory over Malmo made him the first player with at least 10 goals in a group stage of the Champions League.

results.title: N.H.L.’s Backup Goalies, Living in the Moment, Thrive at Stepping In
results.abstract: Knowing that their workloads — and their fortunes — can change in a flash is just part of the game for players like the Rangers’ Antti Raanta.

multimedia.caption: Antti Raanta, the Rangers’ backup goalie, with Toronto’s Dion Phaneuf last month. Raanta has won four of the six games he has started this season.

results.title: Islanders Beat Flyers With the Only Goal of the Shootout
results.abstract: Kyle Okposo’s goal in the shootout sent the Islanders to their sixth win in eight games.

multimedia.caption: Kyle Okposo shooting against Flyers goalie Michal Neuvirth in a shootout to lift the Islanders to a 4-3 victory on Tuesday night.

results.title: Devils Lose to the Maple Leafs in a Shootout
results.abstract: Devils goalie Corey Schneider stopped 36 shots, but Toronto won in the fifth round of the tiebreaker.

results.title: N.H.L. Faces Another Lawsuit Over Head Injuries
results.abstract: A lawsuit by the family of Steve Montador accuses the N.H.L. of breaching its duty to inform players about the long-term dangers of repeated brain trauma. Montador was found to have C.T.E. after his death at 35.

multimedia.caption: Steve Montador, left, died in February at age 35 of an undisclosed cause.

results.title: Roger Federer Drops Stefan Edberg From Coaching Staff
results.abstract: Federer announced that Edberg, his boyhood idol and assistant coach, would be replaced by Ivan Ljubicic, Federer’s good friend.

results.title: Oscar Pistorius Granted Bail Ahead of Sentencing
results.abstract: A lawyer for the Olympic athlete known as the Blade Runner said his client would appeal his murder conviction to South Africa’s highest court.

results.title: Tyson Fury in Police Investigation
results.abstract: Fury is being investigated over a report of a hate crime and has reportedly been stripped of his International Boxing Federation heavyweight title.
